publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1132.1 Mr Mark Ruskell: Chardon LL Maize-As an amendment to motion (S2M-1132) in the name of Nora Radcliffe, leave out from "tough" to "continue" and insert "poor performance of Chardon LL as a crop; further notes how this poor performance could be used by the Scottish Executive as a valid reason to reject the addition of the crop to the UK seed list; believes that the Executive is failing to use its wide legal powers of discretion as exercised by EU states in relation to GM crops; further believes that the Executive is relying on the fortuitous decisions of biotechnology companies to make those decisions it is unwilling to make itself, and calls on the Executive." Supported by: Eleanor Scott*, Chris Ballance*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-1132.1 Chardon LL Maize (lodged on 31 March 2004) Patrick Harvie*, Linda Fabiani*, Shiona Baird*, Robin Harper*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Mark Ballard*

S2M-1132.1 Mr Mark Ruskell: Chardon LL Maize-As an amendment to motion (S2M-1132) in the name of Nora Radcliffe, leave out from "tough" to "continue" and insert "poor performance of Chardon LL as a crop; further notes how this poor performance could be used by the Scottish Executive as a valid reason to reject the addition of the crop to the UK seed list; believes that the Executive is failing to use its wide legal powers of discretion as exercised by EU states in relation to GM crops; further believes that the Executive is relying on the fortuitous decisions of biotechnology companies to make those decisions it is unwilling to make itself, and calls on the Executive." Supported by: Eleanor Scott, Chris Ballance, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Patrick Harvie, Linda Fabiani, Shiona Baird, Robin Harper, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Mark Ballard, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-1132.1 Chardon LL Maize (lodged on 31 March 2004) Frances Curran*
S2M-1132.1 Chardon LL Maize (lodged on 31 March 2004) Tommy Sheridan*
